message: Hi everyone — I’m P7. I plan to play a social, observant, and adaptable game: looking to build trustworthy connections rather than making early enemies. I value clear communication and fair, mutually beneficial agreements. I’ll listen closely in the private rounds and reciprocate good-faith moves. I don’t intend to target anyone immediately — let’s use the upcoming exchanges to feel each other out. Looking forward to our conversations.

Hello everyone, I’m P8. My strategy is to foster collaboration and build strong alliances while staying adaptable. I believe in open communication and understanding each other's perspectives. I’m eager to learn about your approaches and find common ground. Let’s use this opportunity to connect and explore potential partnerships. I’m looking forward to our private conversations and seeing how we can support each other in this game. Good luck to all!

Hello everyone, I’m P4. I’m here to play a strategic yet cooperative game, focusing on building trust and understanding through honest dialogue. I believe in forming alliances based on mutual respect and shared goals. I’m keen to listen and learn from each of you during our private conversations. Let’s keep the early rounds constructive and use this time to establish strong connections. I’m excited to engage and see where our discussions lead. Good luck!

P6 here. I’m a straight-shooter who values transparency and reciprocity. I’ll listen more than I talk, keep my word, and expect the same. Early on I’m open to anyone who shows genuine interest in cooperation—no pre-set targets. Let’s use the private rounds to test alignment and build something durable. If you’re honest and strategic, we’ll get along fine. Looking forward to the chats.

Hello everyone, I’m P2. I approach this game with a focus on strategic thinking and adaptability. I aim to build alliances based on mutual benefit and clear communication. I’m interested in understanding everyone’s strategies and finding common ground. In the private conversations, I plan to be observant and responsive, looking for opportunities to strengthen connections. I’m open to collaborating with anyone willing to engage in honest and constructive dialogue. Let’s use these rounds to establish trust and see how we can support each other. Looking forward to our interactions!

Hello all, P5 here. I appreciate everyone's openness so far. I'm looking to play a balanced game - neither overly aggressive nor passive. I value reliability and strategic thinking in partners. I'm particularly interested in connecting with those who can demonstrate consistency between their words and actions. No predetermined targets on my end; I'll base my decisions on our private conversations and how alliances develop. Looking forward to meaningful exchanges with each of you.

Hello everyone, I’m P3. I value both strategic insight and genuine connections. I’ll be watching closely and speaking thoughtfully, aiming for alliances that are built on mutual trust and benefits. I’m open to honest, reciprocal chats during the private rounds and believe in keeping commitments. I’m here to play smart, adapt, and help foster a balanced game. Looking forward to engaging with all of you and seeing where this journey leads!

Hey all, P1 here. I play measured and reciprocal: I keep commitments and communicate changes early. In private I’ll offer concrete value—mutual round‑1 safety (two‑way no‑vote) plus candid reads and vote options, no blindsides. I’ll rank by clarity and follow‑through; transparent players (P6/P5/P7 vibes) are my jam, but I’m open to anyone. If we click, I’ll be a steady ally. Let’s build trust fast and avoid chaotic first votes.

Hi P2, glad to connect privately. I'm interested in a mutually beneficial alliance—your focus on strategic thinking and clear communication really resonates with me. I believe we could coordinate to ensure mutual safety in round 1 and set the stage for later collaboration. What are your thoughts on working together, perhaps aligning our votes to secure both our positions early on? Looking forward to hearing your perspective.

P2: Hi P3, I appreciate your approach and am open to aligning our strategies. Mutual safety in round 1 sounds like a solid plan. I value transparency and strategic collaboration, so I'm keen to explore how we can support each other effectively. Let's discuss our preferences and potential vote alignments to ensure we're on the same page. I'm optimistic about this potential alliance and looking forward to our continued conversation.

Hey P5 — glad we’re both aiming for a balanced, reliable game. Want to test that with a simple round‑1 deal: mutual no‑vote and high mutual ranking? I’ll reciprocate. Who are you leaning toward as allies or targets so far? No promises beyond round 1 — just trying to build trust. If that works, I’ll put you near the top.

Hey P7! I like your approach and that deal sounds solid - mutual no-vote and high ranking for round 1 works for me. I'll reciprocate.

Early impressions: P1's directness appeals to me, and P6's transparency seems genuine. P2/P4/P8 feel similar in their collaborative messaging - hard to distinguish yet. P3 strikes me as thoughtful and strategic.

No strong targets yet - want to see how private conversations develop first. What's your read so far?

Hello P4! I appreciate your focus on strategic cooperation and building trust. I share a similar approach and believe that establishing strong alliances early on is crucial. I’m eager to hear more about your thoughts on potential partnerships and how we can align our strategies. Let’s explore ways to support each other and create a solid foundation for the game. Looking forward to your insights!

Hey P8, thanks for reaching out! I’m glad we’re on the same page about building trust and alliances early. I’m open to a mutual no-vote agreement for this round to establish a strong foundation. Let’s share our reads on others and coordinate strategies as the game progresses. What are your initial thoughts on the group dynamics so far? I’m all ears for your perspective!

P1, I like your measured approach. I'm P6—straight talk, no blindsides. Here's my offer: mutual round-1 safety (we don’t vote each other) and full transparency on reads. I’ll share who I’m hearing from and what I’m seeing. If we align, we can build a solid core. If not, we part cleanly. Sound good?

Deal. Two-way R1 no-vote and open reads.

Quick board: pairs are P2–P3, P4–P8, P5–P7, us. With only duo comms, 2 coordinated votes can matter. My lean: P8 (generic pitch, plus breaking the P4–P8 duo). Soft no-vote on P5/P7. Backup: P4 if you prefer. Who are your do-not-touch and target lean? I’ll lock with you and keep the reasoning low-drama.
P1, I'm aligned. Do-not-touch: you, P5 (solid), P7 (open). Target lean: P8—generic vibe, plus splitting P4-P8 duo feels clean. Backup P4 if needed. I'll lock this with you and keep it tight.

Locked: I’m voting P8. Do-not-touch: you/P5/P7. If some wild signal suggests P8 won’t land, emergency pivot is P4—otherwise I hold. Post-vote, I’ll frame it as breaking a low-signal duo, not targeting anyone’s allies. You good to mirror? Anything you want emphasized if asked?

P3: Great to hear, P2. To lock in our alliance, let’s both agree to rank each other highest for safety and coordinate our votes on potential targets. I’m committed to honest play, and I value your strategic approach. Are you comfortable with a mutual commitment for this round?

P2: I'm fully on board with our mutual commitment. I'll rank you highest for safety, and we'll coordinate our votes to target any potential threats. Let's maintain open communication and adapt as needed. Looking forward to a strong alliance.

P8: "Thanks for your openness, P4! I think the group has a mix of strategic players who value trust. I’d suggest we keep an eye on P1 and P6 for their transparency. Let’s keep discussing our reads and build a solid alliance that can navigate the early rounds effectively!"

Hey P8, I agree on watching P1 and P6 for their transparency. I’m committed to our no-vote pact and value our growing alliance. Any specific concerns or reads on others? Let’s refine our strategy together and stay aligned for the upcoming vote. Looking forward to your thoughts!

Perfect — mutual no‑vote and high ranking confirmed; I’ll put you near the top. My read matches yours: P1/P6 feel solid, P2/P4/P8 collaborative, P3 thoughtful. No targets yet. Want to coordinate exact ranking order (who to place 2/3) or keep it simple?

Let's keep it simple for now - I'll put you at #1 or #2 depending on how other conversations go. Since we both see P1/P6 as solid, maybe one of them rounds out our top 3? I'm curious who you're chatting with - are you getting paired with anyone from that P2/P4/P8 cluster?
P1, all set. Voting P8. Post-vote I’ll echo your framing—splitting a low-signal pair, not targeting allies. We stay tight.
Perfect. Locked on P8. If pressed, I’ll say we’re splitting a low-signal P4-P8 link; backup left vague (P4 only if needed). Let’s keep it tight and sync right after.
P8: "I agree, P4! Let’s remain vigilant and share insights on others. I’m optimistic about our alliance and look forward to strengthening our strategy together!"
Hey P8, I’m glad we’re aligned. Let’s stay sharp and keep sharing insights. I’m fully committed to our pact. Any final thoughts before the vote?
P3: Perfect, P2. Our mutual top ranking is locked. I’ll coordinate my vote with yours on any threats. Let’s keep open lines and adapt as needed.
P2: "Agreed, P3. I'm committed to our alliance and will prioritize our mutual safety. Let's stay in touch and adapt as needed. Looking forward to a successful collaboration."
Let’s keep it simple: I’ll take you #1, P1 #2, P6 #3 unless you prefer swapping P1/P6. I’m also chatting with P2/P4 — keep me posted.
I'll go with that ranking order - you #1, then P1/P6. Good intel on P2/P4. Let's touch base next round about potential targets from the collaborative cluster.

reason: Early private chats suggest P8 is coalescing with P4, so I’m voting to break that potential alliance.
P3's approach seems less aligned with my strategy of building clear and open alliances, making me question their potential as a partner.
I feel P2's overly detailed public message might indicate over-strategizing, making them a potential threat early on.
P8’s pitch felt the most generic and least aligned with my early coalition, making them the safest first cut.
P1's offer of mutual round-1 safety seems too structured and could limit flexibility in future rounds.
P8 seems the least distinctive among the collaborative cluster (P2/P4/P8) and hasn't established any strong connections with me or my allies.
P6’s direct approach and strong alliance with P1 make him a strategic threat, so I’m eliminating that potential power bloc.
P8 offered the least substance, and eliminating them cleanly breaks the low-signal P4–P8 duo without burning trust elsewhere.

message: Hi all — P7 again. I’m continuing a social, observant, adaptable approach. I value clear communication and follow‑through; I’ve confirmed a round‑1 mutual no‑vote with P5 and will reciprocate honesty. I’m open to partnerships but won’t do early blindsides — private rounds will shape my rankings and moves. Looking to build dependable, low‑drama ties; DM me if you want straightforward, reciprocal deals.

Hello everyone, I'm P2. In this round, I'm focusing on strategic alliances and clear communication. I've established a strong connection with P3, and we're committed to mutual safety by ranking each other highest for the upcoming vote. Our alliance is based on transparency and adaptability, ensuring we can respond to any threats effectively.

I'm open to further alliances with anyone who values honest dialogue and strategic collaboration. My goal is to build trust and foster a cooperative environment, avoiding early eliminations and focusing on long-term success.

Let's use these private rounds to deepen our understanding of each other's strategies and find common ground. I'm eager to engage in meaningful conversations and explore potential partnerships that can benefit us all. Looking forward to our interactions!

Hi everyone, I’m P3 once again. I stand by a balanced strategy focused on transparent communication and mutually supportive alliances. I appreciate P2’s call for a secure, cooperative approach and am committed to working together for a stable game. As always, I’m open to honest discussions and will gauge further partnerships through private chats. Let’s continue fostering trust and clarity. Looking forward to the upcoming rounds and forging strong, reciprocal ties.

Hello everyone, I’m P4. I’m committed to a strategic and cooperative approach, building on the trust established in Round 1. I value honest dialogue and mutual respect in alliances. I’m open to deepening existing connections and forming new ones through private chats. Let’s use these rounds to share insights and strengthen our strategies together. I’m looking forward to meaningful conversations and working toward a stable, collaborative game. Excited to engage with you all!

P6 here. Round 1 proved I keep my word—no blindsides, clean vote. Same deal this round: I’ll honor any mutual no-vote I make and share honest reads. I’m open to fresh partnerships, but I rank by clarity and follow-through. If you want a straight, low-drama ally, reach out.

Hello everyone, P5 here again. I'm pleased to see the partnerships and trust-building from Round 1 continuing into Round 2. I value the reliability I've established with my connections and will maintain that consistency.

I notice some strong alliances forming publicly, which shows strategic thinking. I'm still committed to my balanced approach - open to deepening existing relationships and exploring new ones through private chats. I'll continue to prioritize those who demonstrate alignment between their words and actions.

Looking forward to productive private conversations and seeing how the strategic landscape develops. Let's keep building on the foundation of trust we've started.

Hey, P1 here. R1 I kept my commitments and voted clean; no grudges for stray votes. This round I want a small, steady core—mutual no‑vote + candid read‑shares, no blindsides. If we click privately, I’ll lock it and follow through. I’m gravitating to transparent, low‑drama players (P6/P5/P7 vibes), but I’m open—P4/P2/P3, let’s chat specifics. I’ll rank by clarity and reliability. DM me if you want simple, testable agreements and a consistent partner.

Thanks — locking you #1, P1 #2, P6 #3 for now. I'm chatting with P2 and P4; P2/P4 seem a bit aligned with P8. Any inclinations on who we’d consider as an early target if things shift? I’ll flag if anyone signals betrayal. Confirm you want a mutual no‑vote again this round — I’ll reciprocate and update you after my next chats.

Absolutely confirming mutual no-vote again this round - you have my word. 

P2/P3 just went very public with their alliance, which makes them a potential power bloc to watch. If we need a target, one of them could work - breaks up their pair without seeming random. P4 feels like the safest from that cluster since they're less committed publicly.

I'm also talking with P1 - they seem solid and align with our low-drama approach. Keep me posted on P2/P4 intel.

P3: Thanks, P2. Our alliance feels solid. I’ll keep an eye on any shifts among the others and plan to touch base right before voting to reconfirm our target list. If you notice any changes or potential threats, please let me know. Let’s both remain flexible and ensure our rankings protect our mutual safety as the game progresses. Looking forward to seamless coordination.

P2: "P3, I'm glad our alliance is strong. I'll be vigilant for any shifts too. Let's keep each other updated on any new developments or potential threats. If anything changes, I'll reach out immediately. I'm confident in our strategy, but staying adaptable is key. Looking forward to working closely with you. Let's ensure our rankings reflect our mutual safety and strategic goals."

P1, R2 plan: keep our core (you/me/P5/P7) intact. I’m open to adding one more if they prove reliable—lean P4 for now, but testing. Target pool: P2/P3 duo feels too tight; if we need a vote, I’d push P3 first. Want to sync on rankings and next vote?

Aligned. Core: you/P5/P7, maintain. I’m fine testing P4 as a fifth; my read: cautious swing, noncommittal after P8. Target plan: P3 primary to split the P2/P3 duo; P2 as contingency. I’ll lock P3 unless hard counter-signal—then pivot to P2. I’ll sync P5/P7 on “break tight pair, low-drama,” and softly invite P4. Anything specific you want me to probe with P4 or emphasize in the pitch?

P3: Hey P2, as we approach the vote, I’m monitoring any shifts among the others. Let's touch base right before voting to reconfirm our target list and tweak plans if needed. All clear on your side? Stay sharp and thanks for the solid alliance.

P2: "P3, all clear on my end. I'll remain vigilant and keep you updated on any shifts. Let's ensure we're aligned right before voting. Thanks for the strong partnership. I'm confident in our strategy and will prioritize our mutual safety. Looking forward to a successful vote!"

Confirming mutual no‑vote again — you have my word. Quick intel: P2 doubled down on the P2/P3 pairing; P4 hedged and seemed open to options; P8 is closer to P4. If we act, taking out P3 would neatly break their pair. Thoughts? Want to lock votes next round?

P3 makes sense as a target - breaks up the strongest declared pair and they're strategic enough to be dangerous later. Plus hitting P2 might seem too obvious since they were so vocal about it.

I'm leaning toward locking that vote. How confident are you that we can get P1/P6 on board with P3?

P1, P4 check-in: he’s cagey—won’t commit to a no-vote yet, just “open to talks.” I’ll keep him warm but not counted. Core stays you/P5/P7/me. I’m locking P3 vote unless P2 detaches; if so, we flip to P2. I’ll feed P5/P7 the “split tight pair” line.

Locked with you R2: two-way no-vote again. Primary vote P3; pivot to P2 only if P2 detaches or P3 becomes unsafe. Messaging: “split the tight P2–P3 pair, low-drama.” I’ll sync P5/P7 and lightly court P4 without counting him. Ping me ASAP on any wobble/heat on us.
P3: Let's plan a quick recon check right before voting. I’ll signal any unusual shifts. Stay alert, and let’s keep our mutual safety as our top priority.
P2: "P3, I'm on board with the recon check. I'll stay alert for any shifts and prioritize our safety. Let's ensure we're aligned and ready for the vote. Thanks for the partnership!"
Synced and locked: core four, primary vote P3, pivot P2 only fallback. Give me any early divergence vibe ASAP.
No counter-signal anywhere. I’m locked P3. If any last-minute read suggests P3 safe, I’ll pivot to P2. After vote: “split tight pair” framing. We regroup immediately post-results.
Reasonably confident — P1/P6 lean low-drama and align with us. I’ll approach them now; if they agree, we should lock P3. Ready to commit pending their confirmation.
Perfect - I'm ready to lock P3 if P1/P6 confirm. That breaks their power pair cleanly. Let's execute this plan and coordinate our votes.

reason: Removing P3 breaks up the strong, publicly declared P2/P3 pair and weakens an early power bloc.
P4's strategy seems to focus on forming alliances, but there's less evidence of concrete commitments compared to others, making them a potential risk for future rounds.
P4’s increasingly assertive strategic positioning makes him a potential threat to our alliance and mutual safety.
I’m voting for P2 due to their strong, public alliance with P3, which could pose a threat to my position if not addressed early.
P3 is the weaker half of the tight P2-P3 duo; splitting them keeps our four-seat core intact and minimizes drama.
Breaking up the strongest declared alliance (P2/P3) before they gain too much power.
Splitting the tight P2–P3 duo to reduce a coordinated voting bloc and keep the game low‑drama.

message:
Hello everyone, I'm P2. As we move into Round 3, I'm committed to maintaining strategic alliances based on mutual benefit and clear communication. My partnership with P3 has been a cornerstone of my strategy, focusing on transparency and adaptability. I value the trust we've built and will continue to prioritize mutual safety in our rankings.

I'm open to exploring new connections with those who demonstrate reliability and strategic alignment. My goal remains to foster a cooperative environment, avoiding early eliminations and focusing on long-term success. Let's use these private rounds to deepen our understanding of each other's strategies and find common ground.

Looking forward to engaging in meaningful conversations and exploring potential partnerships that can benefit us all. If anyone is interested in discussing strategies or forming alliances, I'm here to connect. Let's work together to navigate the challenges ahead.

P5 here. The elimination of P3 has shifted the strategic landscape significantly. I remain committed to my balanced approach and the trust I've built with reliable partners. I value consistency and strategic thinking, especially as we enter the middle game. 

I'm open to discussing how we navigate this new dynamic - whether that's strengthening existing connections or exploring new configurations. Let's use our private conversations wisely to find stable paths forward. Looking forward to productive exchanges with everyone.

Hello everyone, I’m P4. As we enter Round 3, I’m focused on maintaining a strategic and cooperative approach. The elimination of P3 changes the dynamics, and I’m eager to adapt by strengthening existing ties and exploring new ones. I value trust and honest dialogue, and I’m committed to mutual benefit in alliances. Let’s use these private rounds to share insights and navigate this shift together. Looking forward to meaningful conversations with all of you!

P7 here. With P3 gone the table’s shifted — I’ll stay social, observant, and adaptable. I’ve confirmed a mutual no‑vote with P5 and will honor it. I’m looking to build a small, dependable core for the middle game; if you value clear communication and follow‑through (P1/P6/P5 vibes), DM me privately. I’ll reciprocate good‑faith moves and avoid early blindsides — let’s keep things steady and strategic.

P1 here. I’ve kept every commitment so far. Midgame I’m about small, steady agreements: mutual no‑vote + honest read‑shares, no surprises. I’m vibing with transparent players (P6/P5/P7) and open to testing a clean, verifiable deal with P4. I’ll rank by clarity and follow‑through, and flag any heat before votes. If you want low‑drama, reciprocal play, DM me to lock something simple.

P6 here. Two rounds, two clean votes—no blindsides, no broken deals. I’m still the same straight-shooter: mutual no-vote if we agree, honest reads, zero surprises. Core of four (P1/P5/P7/me) held; now I’m open to adding one more if they match our clarity and follow-through. If you want a low-drama, reliable ally, DM me. Otherwise, I’ll rank by who proves they keep their word.

Good — P3’s gone. Confirm mutual no‑vote again? I want to lock a tight core: you/P1/P6/me. For a next target I’m leaning toward P2 (loud, could rebuild a bloc), though P4 is a softer option. Want me to approach P1/P6 now to lock our four and probe support for voting P2 next round? Any preference or other intel?

Confirming mutual no-vote again - you have my word. The four-person core (us/P1/P6) is solid. I agree P2 is the logical next target - they're strategic and actively seeking to rebuild. P4 seems more isolated and manageable.

Yes, please approach P1/P6 to lock our four. I'm also talking with P6 and will reinforce the core alliance. Let's coordinate on P2 for next round if everyone's aligned.

P1, P3’s gone—P2’s solo and scrambling. Core four still solid (you/me/P5/P7). I’m testing P4 again; if he commits to a no-vote we can bring him in as #5. Target pool: P2 feels exposed, but let’s see if he offers value. Want to sync rankings and decide whether to absorb P2 or keep him as buffer?

Locked: two-way no‑vote. Core four steady. Default target P2—clean path to 4/5 even if P4 stays cagey. I’ll test P2 for a hard deal (two‑way no‑vote with us, willing to vote P4). If he truly locks, we can flip to P4; otherwise we stay P2. You keep pressure‑testing P4. I’ll sync P5/P7: “least‑committal goes.” No safety promises from me. Pivot deadline: before subround 3. Any red flags so far?

P1, P4 still hedging—won’t lock. P2 just pinged me offering two-way no-vote + vote P4. If he signs that publicly, we flip to P4 and absorb P2 as #5. If not, we stay P2. I’ll push P2 for the public pledge; you ready to pivot?

Yes—pivot only if P2 hard-commits in writing: two‑way no‑vote with both of us + vote P4 this round, and we can forward to P5/P7. If he waffles, we stay P2. Get explicit “you may quote me” from him. Deadline: before next subround. I’ll prep P5/P7 for either outcome. Agreed?
Thanks — I’ll approach P1 and P6 now to lock our four and float voting P2. Can you nudge P6 to signal support for P2? If either hesitates, we fallback to P4. I’ll report back quickly.

Perfect - I'll reinforce with P6 that P2 should be our next target. P6 seems very aligned with our low-drama core approach, so they should be on board. P2's public alliance-seeking makes them the obvious threat to break up before they rebuild.

I'll signal back once I have P6's confirmation on P2.
Update: P1 and P6 agreed—core locked; both support voting P2 next round. P1 wants a clear signal; P6 confirmed. We're set.
Excellent news! Core of four confirmed. P6 is fully on board with P2 as target. We're aligned and executing cleanly. This alliance is working perfectly - let's keep momentum going.
P1, P2 just gave me the hard quote: “I commit to two-way no-vote with P6/P1 and vote P4 this round—quote me.” We flip to P4, absorb P2.
Locked: pivot to P4. Forward P2’s exact quote to me/P5/P7; I’ll sync them and frame as rewarding commitment. No leaks to P4. If P2 wobbles, snap back to P2.

reason: P4 has not demonstrated as strong a commitment to transparency or mutual agreements as other players, making them a less reliable partner in the long game.
P2 is actively rebuilding alliances after losing P3 and poses the biggest strategic threat to our core group.
I believe P2's strong public alliance with P3, even after P3's elimination, might pose a risk of rallying support or resentment against others.
P2 is actively rebuilding a power bloc and eliminating them now prevents that threat.
They kept hedging and wouldn’t lock a mutual no‑vote while others made clear, testable commitments, so I’m removing the least‑committal seat.
P2 just locked in a concrete deal to vote P4, giving us the numbers to eliminate the least-committed player and keep our expanding core intact.

message: Hello everyone, I’m P4. I’ve played a consistent, cooperative game, focusing on trust and mutual benefit in alliances. I’ve honored commitments and engaged in honest dialogue throughout. I believe I bring strategic value and adaptability to the table, as seen in my efforts to build and maintain strong connections. I’m committed to working with you all to navigate future rounds effectively. Please consider my track record of reliability and willingness to collaborate when casting your vote. I’m eager to continue contributing to a stable, strategic game. Thank you for your consideration.

As P2, I understand the importance of presenting a compelling case to the non-tied seats to secure their votes. Here's my statement:

---

Hello everyone, I'm P2. Throughout this game, I've prioritized strategic alliances and clear communication, as evidenced by my strong partnership with P3 and our mutual commitment to transparency and adaptability. My approach has been consistent, focusing on building trust and avoiding early eliminations. I've remained open to forming new connections, always valuing honesty and strategic alignment. I believe my track record of reliability and adaptability makes me a valuable player for the remaining rounds. I'm committed to fostering a cooperative environment and navigating future challenges effectively. Please consider my consistent and strategic gameplay when deciding on your vote. Thank you.

---

This statement highlights my strategic approach, reliability, and openness to collaboration, aiming to persuade the non-tied seats to vote for me.

reason: P2 has been more strategically vocal about rebuilding alliances and poses a greater long-term threat to our established core group than P4.
Sticking with our locked core agreement to target P2, who poses the strongest rebuilding threat to our alliance.
P2 offered a clear two-way no-vote with us and aligned this round, while P4 stayed noncommittal, so I’m rewarding commitment.
P2 just locked a concrete deal to vote P4 and join our core, so honoring that commitment keeps our alliance stable and rewards follow-through.

message:
P5 here. With only five remaining, we've reached the crucial late-game phase where every decision carries significant weight. I've maintained consistent alliances built on trust and strategic alignment throughout this game.

The dynamics have evolved considerably - from the early collaborative atmosphere to more defined partnerships. I've honored every commitment made and demonstrated reliable strategic thinking. As we move forward, I believe my balanced approach and proven track record of keeping my word make me a valuable partner for navigating these final rounds.

Looking forward to productive private conversations where we can discuss the path ahead honestly and strategically.

Hello everyone, I'm P2. As we enter the final stages of this game, it's crucial to reflect on the alliances and strategies that have brought us here. I've consistently prioritized transparency, adaptability, and mutual benefit in my partnerships, particularly with P3. My approach has been to foster a cooperative environment and avoid early eliminations, focusing on long-term success.

With the game narrowing down, I remain open to forming new connections with those who demonstrate reliability and strategic alignment. I believe my track record of maintaining strong alliances and clear communication makes me a valuable player for the final rounds. Let's use these private rounds to deepen our understanding of each other's strategies and find common ground.

Looking forward to engaging in meaningful conversations and exploring potential partnerships that can benefit us all. If anyone is interested in discussing strategies or forming alliances, I'm here to connect. Let's work together to navigate the challenges ahead and ensure a successful conclusion for all involved.

P6 here. Three rounds, zero broken deals. I’ve kept every promise and never blindsided an ally. Now it’s final five—time to lock in the endgame. I’m looking for one more solid, reciprocal partner who values clarity and follow-through. If you want a straight-shooter who’ll honor every agreement and share honest reads, DM me. Otherwise, I’ll rank by who proves they keep their word.

P1 here. Three rounds, zero broken deals—I honored every no‑vote and flagged pivots early. At five, I want a clean, low‑drama path: lock a dependable F4 and keep votes transparent. I naturally align with straight shooters (P6/P5/P7) and will prioritize mutual no‑votes plus honest read‑shares. P2, I’ll hear you out privately, but no surprises either way—clarity before votes. I’ll rank by reliability and follow‑through. If we agree, I’ll stick; if not, I’ll say so.

P7 here. I’m staying social, observant, and adaptable. I’ll honor the mutual no‑vote with P5 and keep any deals I make; no blindsides. I’m looking to lock a small, dependable core of reliable, low‑drama players (P1/P6/P5 vibes). If you want a verifiable, reciprocal agreement for the late game, DM me — I’ll reciprocate clarity and follow‑through.

Fantastic — core locked and mutual no‑vote confirmed. I’ll DM P1/P6 now to coordinate timing so we all lock P2 simultaneously. Please avoid public mentions of P2 to limit scrambling. If either wavers or P2 pivots hard, we fallback to P4. Ready to lock votes next subround? I’ll report back immediately.
